title: Forget Relationships For A Sec, I Keep Getting Ghosted By Cab Drivers A Lot & That Sh*t Hurts!
text:
I miss the simpler times when you could call someone or send a message and there was no way to find out if they’d seen it or not. There were no ‘last seen,’ there were no blue ticks, and, consequently, there was no stress over whether you were being ignored by someone else.

Of course, it’s no surprise that one would feel bad if their loved ones didn’t respond to them. However, there is a heartbreak more painful than this one and it is when your cab driver ghosts you.

If you are privileged enough to not know what I’m talking about, you can turn back now. But if you live in the world of “Bhaiya, location pe aa jao” and ‘5 star ratings,' you know exactly what I’m talking about.

Getting ghosted by your cab driver not only hurts you but is an extremely inconvenient experience to have.

The only difference between getting ghosted by a guy/girl and a cab driver is that at least you can find another cab instantly. Oh wait, thanks to online dating apps, we can do the same with dates too now. My bad.

How bad is it?

Apart from all that, there is nothing pleasant about being ditched by your cab driver.

Picture this: Your phone has 5 per cent battery and it's at 2:00am. You’re in unfamiliar territory and you book a cab. The app shows that the driver is just five minutes away. You thank your stars and move on to the pick-up spot.

Just a minute before the driver is about to reach, he calls and asks where you intend to go. Even though you know what’s coming, you mumble the name of the location which is really far from your present one. On the other end, the driver tells you he’s almost there but you know it in your heart that he won’t show up. Your phone is now on 3 per cent and the app shows you that they’re trying to find another cab for you.

It’s almost like cabbies have a fear of commitment. The moment you talk about going the long way, they decide to block you. In this case, they literally cancel you. Matlab, agar nahi jana toh bata do na. Don’t raise our hopes by saying, “Haan, bas aa gaya" and vanish into thin air.

I have personally been ghosted by cab drivers so often--no, I’m not kidding--that I’d rather have a heartbreak than be stranded on the road.

There have been times when I’ve justified the driver’s behaviour and told myself that maybe my destination is really out of his way. But what do you do when your drop location isn’t even that far and your driver still chooses to tell you to fuck off?

Once, I added a stop during my journey and like the good person I am, I made sure that the stop is on the way to my destination and the driver doesn’t have to make a detour. Politely, I asked him to accept the update and make a stop for a minute.

The app specifically tells you that it is acceptable to make a stop for three minutes and less. It’s a goddamn feature of the service I’m using. For some reason, he didn’t accept the change and stopped at the location I had added. I told him I’ll be right back and before anyone could count to hundred, I returned to the spot he was supposedly waiting for me.

Guess what? I saw no cab there, only a fool. A fool who had to book another cab to get to a location which was just five minutes away now. The asshole just bounced without telling me. Matlab agar takleef hai, toh bata do na. It personally pisses me off when they behave like it’s okay and then ditch you.

If I’m booking a cab in the morning to get to work and the driver calls me up to confirm the booking (we all know it’s just a trick to find out the destination) and tells me he’s on his way, I expect him to show up. Cab drivers need to stop playing with our emotions and telling us that they’ll be right there, when in reality, they have no plans of ever meeting us.

What can you even do?

File a complaint with the app and expect them to get back to you. We all know how inconsequential that is and you’d rather just book another cab. But then you stop and wonder to yourself that if no one ever brings this up, cab drivers are going to continue to ghost people. No wonder millennials are never on time. Their hearts are hurting due to being left on read by their latest crush and they can’t reach work on time because their cabbies are ghosting them. Is the universe always working against us?

Why are cab drivers who cancel the trip like pregnancy scares? Because they make us late. — Aishwarya Dharni (@aishdharni) October 14, 2019

Do you have cab ghosting stories too? Let us know in the comments.

Getting ghosted by your cab driver not only hurts you but is an extremely inconvenient experience to go through. No one likes it but it happens so frequently, it has become a part of our lives.
